channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: Agency Assist; INC#1141; 03:03PM; Lopez Canyon; MAP: <a href="https://maps.app.goo.gl/zyD266CHvZ54Tt8M9" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://maps.app.goo.gl/zyD266CHvZ54Tt8M9</a>; #AngelesNationalForest; PRELIM: LAFD ground and air response with Los Angeles County (LACoFD) and Angeles National Forest (ANF) Firefighters in Automatic Aid to the "Lopez Fire", a vegetation fire near Lopez Canyon Road, in a Mutual Threat Zone within the Angeles National Forest near the three agencies' common border. This fire is outside the City of Los Angeles, and no City of Los Angeles residents are currently threatened. All Media Inquiries should be directed to Angeles National Forest Public Information Officer(s).; Council District Outside the City of Los Angeles; AO1 AO2 BC12 BC14 E24 E274 E275 E290 E298 E7 E91 E98 EM12 H3 H5 H7 HA3 HA5 HA7 RA98 SO1 T74 T75 T90 T98 + LACoFD + ANF; CH5; 17; Brian Humphrey

Update Structure Fire; INC#1226; 04:45PM; 12601 W Van Nuys Bl; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/4b2eqac" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/4b2eqac</a>; #Pacoima; LAFD Firefighters systematically searching in the smoke-charged two story townhome quickly found and began resuscitative efforts on the two limp and apparently lifeless pet cats. Their perseverant efforts continued outdoors with the provision of medical oxygen and physical stimulation that soon restored their breathing and consciousness. The felines have been taken by their owner to a nearby emergency veterinarian, with a very promising outlook. There were no other human or animal injuries. No other animals are reported missing. The cause of the fire, which heavily damaged the kitchen, remains under investigation.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC10 BC12 E275 E298 E75 E77 E98 EM12 RA77 RA87 RA898 T75 T98; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#1226; 03:44PM; 12601 W Van Nuys Bl; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/4b2eqac" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/4b2eqac</a>; #Pacoima; First arriving 12 LAFD Firefighters took just 13 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish fire involving a dishwasher in the second floor kitchen area of a of a two-story townhome. No human injury. Firefighters continue a methodic search of the smoke-charged premises for pet felines.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC10 BC12 E275 E298 E75 E77 E98 EM12 RA77 RA87 RA898 T75 T98; CH9; 17; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#1226; 03:31PM; 12601 W Van Nuys Bl; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/4b2eqac" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/4b2eqac</a>; #Pacoima; PRELIM: Kitchen fire in one unit of a two-story (combination garden-style/center-hallway style) apartment building.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC10 BC12 E275 E298 E75 E77 E98 EM12 RA77 RA87 RA898 T75 T98; CH9; 17; Brian Humphrey

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0196; 04:35AM; 2135 W Slauson Av; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3XntfRU" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3XntfRU</a>; #ChesterfieldSquare; Firefighters arrived at the site of a previous burn (from just over 24 hours prior) to find a one-story commercial with heavy fire showing. As crews deployed hose lines and placed ladders, the flames grew rapidly in the already-ventilated building. Firefighters pulled back into defensive mode early in the incident, setting up ladder pipes, portable monitors, and other large hose lines (master streams). The fire consumed two adjacent occupancies, that share a center wall: a one-story commercial and a one-story church. Thankfully, there were no reported injuries. It took 83 firefighters 77 minutes to extinguish the blaze. Per protocol for fires involving a House of Worship, Arson Investigators are responding to conduct an investigation. There will be smoke in the area and crews working on scene for an extended period of time, as the hot spots under the debris continue to smolder. LAFD Heavy Equipment will aid in removing debris and allowing firefighters to continue applying water to deeper hot layers beneath the surface.; FS 66; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC11 BC13 BC18 BC4 CM20 CM22 E205 E226 E233 E266 E294 E33 E34 E46 E5 E57 E66 E94 EA1 EM11 HE1 HR3 PI2 RA266 RA5 RA66 RA866 SO1 SQ21 T26 T33 T5 T66 T94 UR5 UR88; CH7; 12 13; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0196; 03:18AM; 2135 W Slauson Av; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3XntfRU" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3XntfRU</a>; 1ChesterfieldSquare; One-story commercial building with heavy fire showing. Defensive mode.; FS 66; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC11 BC13 BC18 BC4 CM20 CM22 E205 E226 E233 E266 E294 E33 E34 E46 E5 E57 E66 E94 EM11 HR3 RA5 RA66 RA866 SO1 SQ21 T26 T33 T5 T66 T94 UR5 UR88; CH9; 12 13; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1431; 06:25PM; 7244 S Brynhurst Av; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/4cdQ3Y8" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/4cdQ3Y8</a>; #HydePark; The first 20 firefighters to arrive performed a fast and aggressive fire attack on the one-story single-family home with smoke showing, taking just 15 minutes to respond, make access, and extinguish the flames. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 66; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 BC4 E233 E266 E294 E33 E66 E94 RA266 RA57 RA66 SO1 SQ21 T33 T66 T94; CH7; 12; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1431; 06:10PM; 7244 S Brynhurst Av; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/4cdQ3Y8" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/4cdQ3Y8</a>; #HydePark; One-story single-family home with smoke showing. Offensive mode.; FS 66; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 BC4 E233 E266 E294 E33 E66 E94 RA266 RA57 RA66 SO1 SQ21 T33 T66 T94; CH9; 12; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0145; 03:17AM; 2067 N Mt Olympus Dr; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3VBHDEH" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3VBHDEH</a>; #HollywoodHillsWest; Firefighters gathered furniture and belongings in the living space below the attic fire to cover with plastic and minimize water damage. Crews cut holes in the roof and breached the ceiling to gain attic access with hose lines from above and below. It took 32 firefighters 44 minutes to extinguish the stubborn flames throughout the attic. No reported injury. Cause under investigation. ; FS 41; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; BC18 BC5 E227 E261 E27 E41 E97 RA41 RA97 T27 T61; CH8; 14; Nicholas Prange
